intro: Hieracium isodontum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and stems that bear numerous yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. The plant typically grows in open, grassy areas and is native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. The flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
